featured.text: Called the diamond-water paradox, this is a classic problem posed to students of economics.
Many of his works—depictions of children at play and in school, farm girls attending to their work, hunters and their prey—have become classic images of nineteenth-century American life.

definition.zh_def: 經典的，具有持久價值或重要性的作品或風格。
definition.en_def: A work or style that is considered to have lasting significance or value.
definition.example: The book is a classic of American literature.
